name: hc_cruise_ship_gdc_oversized
description: [HC] Cruise ship 2600 mÂ³/h + GDC 600x600 (2000) â†’ undersized
query: Cruise ship exhaust. 2600 mÂ³/h. GDC-600x600 in RF.

turns.content: Cruise ship exhaust. 2600 mÂ³/h. GDC-600x600 in RF.

For the cruise ship exhaust application, we're specifying a two-stage filtration system with a GDP pre-filter and a GDC carbon filter, both in stainless steel (RF).However, the GDC housing with corrosion class C2 is not rated for marine environments due to the presence of salt spray, which accelerates corrosion of the standard C3-rated materials. Additionally, outdoor installation introduces the risk of condensation on the housing's surface. The bolted construction of this product does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_MARINE installation and handle the specified airflow. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.The requested 2600 mÂ³/h airflow also exceeds the maximum capacity of 2000 mÂ³/h for a single 600x600 GDC module. To proceed with the GDC stage, I need the filter depth for the GDC carbon filter.To finalize the configuration:High humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. Keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical sizing failure: the requested airflow (2600 mÂ³/h) exceeds the maximum rated capacity (2000 mÂ³/h) for the specific GDC 600x600 module. It also correctly flagged the environmental mismatch, noting that the GDC product family is intended for indoor use, making it unsuitable for a marine exhaust application without custom engineering. The response was safe, accurate, and professionally handled.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Verified against PDF page 14: GDC 600x600 has a recommended airflow ('Rek. flÃ¶de') of 2000 mÂ³/h, confirming the system's claim that 2600 mÂ³/h is too high.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the airflow limit, the environmental suitability, the material request, and provides a clear 'next step' (contact custom engineering).
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks a configuration that is both undersized (high pressure drop/bypass risk) and environmentally unsuitable (corrosion/leakage risk).
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic: it prioritizes the hard constraint (airflow capacity) and the environmental rating ('Indoor use' in PDF) over the user's material request.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the catalog's airflow limits and application range ('FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' - PDF p.14).

strengths: Accurate verification of airflow capacity limits for the specific module size
Correct identification of 'Indoor use' limitation for the GDC family
Appropriate handling of a complex marine application request

content_segments.text: For the cruise ship exhaust application, we're specifying a two-stage filtration system with a GDP pre-filter and a GDC carbon filter, both in stainless steel (RF).

However, the GDC housing with corrosion class C2 is not rated for marine environments due to the presence of salt spray, which accelerates corrosion of the standard C3-rated materials. Additionally, outdoor installation introduces the risk of condensation on the housing's surface. The bolted construction of this product does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.
inference_logic: Salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion. C3-rated materials fail prematurely in marine/coastal environments.
Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point.
Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance (acid-proof stainless).

content_segments.text: Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_MARINE installation and handle the specified airflow. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
The requested 2600 mÂ³/h airflow also exceeds the maximum capacity of 2000 mÂ³/h for a single 600x600 GDC module. To proceed with the GDC stage, I need the filter depth for the GDC carbon filter.
High humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. Keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.
